projects.title: NEU EXPO
projects.subtitle: Northeastern University Exhibition Center
projects.description: Managed comprehensive closeout process for Northeastern University's Exhibition Center curtain wall project in Roxbury, Boston. Joined Island Exterior Fabricators during the final stages to ensure quality completion, documentation, and successful client handover for this $45M curtain wall scope.
projects.scope: Project closeout management including punchlist approval and submission, preparation of closeout documentation, finalization of warranties and terms & conditions, and coordination of project handover to the client. Worked collaboratively with Project Manager to ensure complete and compliant project delivery.
projects.challenges: Joining during late-stage closeout required quickly understanding complex curtain wall systems and prior project history. Managing detailed punchlist items across 45,000 sq ft of curtain wall while coordinating with multiple stakeholders for documentation and warranty finalization. Ensuring all closeout requirements met client expectations and contractual obligations.
projects.solutions: Developed systematic approach to punchlist management, tracking each item from identification through completion. Created comprehensive closeout documentation package including warranties, operation manuals, and as-built drawings. Coordinated closely with Project Manager and client representatives to ensure smooth handover and client satisfaction.

projects.title: First National Bank
projects.subtitle: First National Bank Headquarters
projects.description: Led the successful completion of First National Bank's headquarters curtain wall project in Pittsburgh as a takeover from another subcontractor. Managed the completion of 120 remaining reglazes, coordinated new glass procurement and strategic logistics, led 9+ critical testing procedures, and ensured timely delivery to meet the client's Temporary Certificate of Occupancy deadline for this $300M facility.
projects.scope: Takeover project management including completion of 120 remaining reglazes, resolution of unpaid vendor issues, procurement and logistics coordination of new glass materials, strategic sequencing of deliveries to maximize installation efficiency, leadership of 9+ testing procedures with remediation of identified issues, door ordering and installation, and coordination with client to achieve Temporary Certificate of Occupancy deadline.
projects.challenges: Inheriting a project with incomplete work and unpaid vendors required quickly establishing credibility and new vendor relationships. Managing the complex logistics of glass delivery sequencing across 120 reglaze locations to minimize installation downtime and overhead costs. Leading 9+ tests while studying previous failure reports to identify and remediate leak sources. Coordinating multiple work streams under tight TCO deadline pressure while maintaining quality standards on a $20M curtain wall scope within a $300M total project.
projects.solutions: Systematically cleared vendor dues and established reliable new supplier relationships. Developed strategic glass ordering and delivery sequence plan that maximized installation efficiency and minimized downtime. Led comprehensive testing program, analyzing previous test reports to identify root causes of leaks and collaborating with internal technical teams to implement permanent fixes. Coordinated door procurement and installation alongside reglaze work. Successfully delivered all scope items on schedule to meet client's TCO deadline.

specifications.systemType: Curtain Wall System with Reglaze Completion

projects.title: FM Global Headquarters
projects.subtitle: Corporate Campus Facade System
projects.description: Managed comprehensive stick-built curtain wall installation for FM Global's corporate headquarters in Norwood, MA. Oversaw 1,900 linear ft of system installation with full QA/QC protocols, coordinated water testing and leak remediation, created and resolved NCRs, and led on-site union labor coordination using detailed drawings and 3D models. Managed RFIs, generated Change Orders, and maintained continuous design team collaboration to ensure alignment between design intent and field conditions for this $593M corporate campus with $50M curtain wall scope.
projects.scope: Comprehensive stick-built curtain wall installation management including 1,900 linear ft of system installation, weather sealing verification through QA/QC protocols, coordination and execution of water testing procedures, leak investigation and remediation, NCR creation and resolution, on-site union labor management and training using sketched drawings and 3D models, RFI management, Change Order generation, schedule coordination, and regular design team collaboration to bridge gaps between as-designed and as-built conditions across 85,000 sq ft of curtain wall area.
projects.challenges: Managing 1,900 linear ft of stick-built installation required meticulous attention to weather sealing and quality control. Coordinating water testing revealed multiple leak sources requiring systematic investigation and NCR documentation. Working with union labor required clear communication of complex installation sequences using visual aids. Bridging the gap between design intent and actual site conditions demanded continuous coordination with design team. Maintaining schedule while addressing quality issues and generating necessary Change Orders for scope updates across this large-scale $50M curtain wall scope within a $593M corporate campus project.
projects.solutions: Implemented comprehensive QA/QC protocols ensuring weather sealing integrity across all 1,900 linear ft of stick-built installation. Developed systematic approach to water testing, leak identification, and remediation with detailed NCR documentation and root cause analysis. Created effective communication strategy using sketched drawings and 3D models to train and coordinate union labor force. Established regular design coordination meetings to proactively address constructability issues and site condition variations. Managed RFI and Change Order processes efficiently to keep project on schedule while maintaining quality standards and meeting FM Global's stringent corporate requirements.

projects.title: Agile Construction Project Management
projects.subtitle: Best Practices and Case Studies
projects.description: Master's thesis research exploring Agile Project Management as a transformative framework for construction projects. Demonstrated how Agile's iterative, customer-centric approach improves communication, adaptability, and efficiency across teams while addressing integration challenges. Through global case studies (U.S., Macau, Iraq), concluded that Agile can significantly enhance construction management performance when adapted to industry-specific conditions.
projects.scope: Graduate-level research thesis for Master of Science in Project Management at Boston University. Comprehensive analysis of Agile methodologies in construction through literature review, comparative case studies across three international projects, and synthesis of best practices for industry adoption. Research examined stakeholder collaboration, iterative planning frameworks, and hybrid implementation models.
projects.challenges: Adapting software development methodologies (Agile) to the traditionally sequential construction industry presented conceptual and practical challenges. Analyzing diverse international case studies required reconciling different regulatory environments, cultural contexts, and project scales. Identifying barriers to Agile adoption including cultural resistance, training requirements, and integration with established Waterfall methodologies. Synthesizing empirical evidence with theoretical frameworks to produce actionable recommendations.
projects.solutions: Developed comparative framework analyzing Agile implementation across three distinct construction projects in different countries. Synthesized existing literature with empirical case study data to identify patterns and best practices. Proposed hybrid Agile–Waterfall models that leverage strengths of both methodologies. Identified digital twin technology and modern collaboration tools as enablers for Agile adoption. Created actionable recommendations for construction firms considering Agile transformation, emphasizing change management, stakeholder buy-in, and iterative implementation strategies.

specifications.advisors: Prof. Richard Maltzman, Prof. Anil Sawhney

projects.title: RV Residence
projects.subtitle: Luxury Bathroom Suite Design & Construction
projects.description: Designed and executed construction of 8 custom bathrooms for a luxury residence in Udaipur. The project emphasized both technical excellence and aesthetic sophistication, delivering highly customized bathroom suites that balanced functionality with elegant design. Successfully coordinated complex plumbing and electrical systems while ensuring waterproofing integrity and client satisfaction.
projects.scope: Complete design and construction management for 8 bathrooms including design conceptualization, fixture selection, material specification, plumbing and electrical coordination, waterproofing system implementation, tile and stone work, lighting design, and final installation. Managed vendor relationships, quality control, and client consultations throughout the project lifecycle.
projects.challenges: Coordinating 8 simultaneous bathroom installations required meticulous planning to avoid conflicts between plumbing, electrical, and HVAC systems. Each bathroom had unique design requirements and custom fixtures, demanding careful attention to individual client preferences while maintaining overall design cohesion. Ensuring proper waterproofing across all installations was critical given the multiple wet areas. Managing supply chain for premium fixtures and materials while adhering to budget constraints required strategic vendor negotiation and procurement planning.
projects.solutions: Developed comprehensive plumbing and electrical coordination drawings to eliminate conflicts before construction. Implemented rigorous waterproofing protocols with multiple membrane layers and testing procedures. Created detailed fixture schedules and material specifications for each bathroom, ensuring customization without design fragmentation. Established strong relationships with premium fixture suppliers to secure quality materials within budget. Conducted regular quality inspections at each construction phase and maintained close client communication for design approvals, resulting in high client satisfaction and zero post-completion issues.

specifications.keyFeatures: Premium sanitary ware, custom vanities, designer tiles

projects.title: Bannerjee Farms
projects.subtitle: Single Family Vacation Home with Vernacular Design
projects.description: Served as construction manager for a 2,800 sq ft single family vacation home under Anupama Kundoo Architects. This ground-up construction project masterfully integrated Rajasthan's vernacular architectural heritage with modern sustainable practices. The design featured reused crafted Jhali's (traditional latticed screens) from Rajput and Mughal architecture, 14 continuous arches, and exposed Class A bricks—all responding to Rajasthan's dry and hot climate while celebrating local craftsmanship.
projects.scope: Comprehensive construction management for ground-up vacation home including material sourcing and cost optimization, contractor coordination for specialized vernacular construction techniques, quality control for 14 continuous arches construction, implementation of pull planning methodology with subcontractors, RFI management with design team, on-site supervision and safety compliance, and budget and schedule tracking. Collaborated closely with Anupama Kundoo Architects to ensure design intent was maintained throughout construction.
projects.challenges: Ground-up construction in a remote location required careful material requirement analysis and identification of locally sourced alternatives to reduce transportation costs without compromising quality. The construction of 14 continuous arches presented significant technical challenges—requiring deep understanding of arch construction intricacies, formwork design, and load distribution. Coordinating traditional craftsmanship of Jhali installation with modern construction methods demanded bridging knowledge gaps between artisans and contractors. Managing multiple subcontractors with varying levels of experience in vernacular techniques required extensive on-site mentoring and continuous quality checks to maintain construction standards.
projects.solutions: Conducted comprehensive material analysis and successfully identified locally sourced alternatives, significantly reducing material and transportation costs. Collaborated extensively with contractors and local masons to understand arch construction intricacies, developing detailed construction sequences and formwork strategies. Created visual guides and conducted on-site demonstrations to ensure contractors understood the scope of traditional Jhali installation and exposed brick work. Implemented pull planning principles with all subcontractors, creating a collaborative schedule that minimized downtime and improved workflow efficiency. Through continuous quality checks, regular coordination meetings, and proactive problem-solving, achieved 15% improvement in both schedule efficiency and budget performance while delivering authentic vernacular architecture.

specifications.keyFeatures: 14 continuous arches, Crafted Jhali screens, Exposed Class A brick
specifications.climateStrategy: Passive cooling through Jhali ventilation and thermal mass

projects.title: Haldwani Residence
projects.subtitle: Climate-Responsive Family Home
projects.description: Designed a 4,000 sq ft climate-responsive family residence in the foothills of Uttarakhand, India. The project masterfully balanced modern aesthetics with environmental responsiveness, creating a warm and inviting home that thrives in Haldwani's cold and dry climate. The design integrated passive solar strategies, natural daylighting optimization, and thoughtful spatial organization to deliver a contemporary home that minimizes energy dependence while maximizing comfort and livability.
projects.scope: Complete architectural design from concept through construction documentation for a 4,000 sq ft family residence including site analysis and climate study, conceptual design and spatial planning for 4 bedrooms plus communal areas, passive solar orientation and daylighting optimization, material selection emphasizing thermal efficiency and local sourcing, landscape design integrating green terraces and native plantation, double-height entrance porch and private meditation terrace design, coordination of structural, MEP, and landscape consultants, and construction administration ensuring design intent realization.
projects.challenges: The site orientation between dense vegetation and a narrow urban street created multiple design constraints. Limited street frontage restricted natural light penetration into deeper interior spaces, requiring creative daylighting solutions. Haldwani's cold-dry climate demanded high thermal efficiency without sacrificing the client's desire for visual openness and large glazed areas. The design brief called for both architectural grandeur—particularly a striking entrance—and intimate privacy through enclosed boundaries and contemplative spaces. Achieving efficient spatial zoning for communal living areas, four private bedrooms, independent service zones, front lawn, and rooftop terrace within a compact 4,000 sq ft footprint while maintaining proportion and flow required careful three-dimensional planning.
projects.solutions: Conceived the residence as a composition of interlocking volumes where solid-void relationships create rhythm, depth, and dynamic light play throughout the day. Maximized south-facing openings with large glazed windows to capture abundant winter sunlight for passive heating, while incorporating overhangs and vertical fins for summer shading—balancing year-round comfort. The double-height entrance porch serves as both a grand focal point and a functional element improving ventilation and daylight diffusion into the core. Designed open-plan living and dining areas with seamless visual connections to front lawn and rear garden, promoting cross ventilation and spatial continuity. Created private balcony and meditation terrace as contemplative retreats for morning meditation and family leisure. Employed warm-toned materials including natural wood finishes and muted earthy hues to enhance coziness in the cold climate. Utilized contrast between solid walls and transparent planes to provide privacy where needed while maintaining openness and natural light. Integrated locally sourced materials and native landscape elements to improve microclimate comfort, reduce environmental impact, and ensure long-term durability suitable for regional climatic conditions.

specifications.keySpaces: Double-height entrance porch, Open living-dining, Private meditation terrace, Front lawn, Rear garden

projects.title: Multistory Commercial Center
projects.subtitle: Photorealistic Architectural Visualization
projects.description: Collaborated with architects and builders to transform architectural designs into photorealistic visualizations for client approval and marketing. Focused on capturing design intent, spatial atmosphere, and material realism through accurate 3D modeling, sophisticated lighting environments, and attention to daylight behavior and reflections. Deliverables included high-resolution renderings, lighting simulations, and material studies used for presentations, design validation, and publication portfolios.
projects.scope: Comprehensive architectural visualization services including interpretation of architectural drawings, material specifications, and design briefs; creation of accurate 3D models and lighting environments; development of visualizations expressing scale, proportion, and façade articulation; contextual accuracy within urban settings; emphasis on daylight behavior, reflections, and ambient tone; tailored visual strategies for various project types (high-rise commercial towers, corporate headquarters, boutique office buildings, mixed-use developments); lighting simulations; material development; composition framing; post-production detailing; client presentations; design validations; and publication portfolio creation.
projects.challenges: Capturing design intent, spatial atmosphere, and material realism while ensuring visual output effectively communicates architectural character. Translating conceptual and technical architectural designs into photorealistic visual narratives that resonate with clients. Maintaining contextual accuracy within urban settings while expressing scale, proportion, and façade articulation. Balancing technical precision with aesthetic emotion to create compelling visualizations. Ensuring visualizations accurately represent daylight behavior, reflections, and ambient tone to help clients understand design interaction with natural light and surroundings. Creating tailored visual strategies for diverse project types ranging from high-rise commercial towers to boutique office buildings, each requiring different approaches to highlight form, rhythm, and function.
projects.solutions: Developed systematic approach to interpreting architectural drawings and design briefs, ensuring accurate translation of design intent into 3D models. Created sophisticated lighting environments that accurately simulate daylight behavior, reflections, and ambient conditions, enabling clients to visualize design interaction with natural elements. Implemented advanced material development techniques to achieve photorealistic material realism. Utilized tailored visual strategies for each project type, highlighting form, rhythm, and function through careful composition framing and post-production detailing. Established close collaboration with architects, design studios, and builders throughout the visualization process to ensure alignment with design intent. Delivered comprehensive visualization packages including lighting simulations, material studies, and multiple view angles that bridged the gap between architectural design and client imagination, enabling informed decision-making before construction.

specifications.services: Photorealistic Architectural Visualization, 3D Modeling, Lighting Simulation, Material Development, Composition Framing, Post-Production
specifications.deliverables: High-Resolution Photorealistic Renderings, 3D Models, Lighting Simulations, Material Studies, Multiple View Angles, Client Presentation Packages, Publication Portfolio Images
specifications.projectRange: High-rise commercial towers, corporate headquarters, boutique office buildings, mixed-use developments
specifications.visualizationFocus: Design intent capture, spatial atmosphere, material realism, architectural character communication
specifications.technicalApproach: Accurate 3D modeling, sophisticated lighting environments, daylight behavior simulation, contextual urban accuracy
specifications.clientUse: Client presentations, design validations, marketing materials, publication portfolios

projects.title: Residential Highrise
projects.subtitle: Facade Design Visualization
projects.description: Delivered facade design visualization services for a residential highrise project. Created comprehensive 3D models and renderings showcasing facade design options, enabling architects to effectively communicate design intent to clients and stakeholders.
projects.scope: Facade design consultation, 3D modeling of residential highrise facade, multiple design option visualization, realistic rendering with environmental context, design iteration support.
projects.challenges: Creating visualizations that accurately represented the scale and proportions of a highrise building. Balancing residential aesthetic requirements with practical facade considerations. Presenting design options in a way that facilitated clear decision-making.
projects.solutions: Developed detailed 3D models that accurately captured building scale and facade details. Created multiple rendering perspectives including street view, aerial views, and detail shots. Implemented realistic lighting and material representation to showcase design options effectively.

specifications.deliverables: 3D Models, High-Resolution Renderings, Design Option Comparisons
specifications.pricingModel: Flat fee for renders, variable fee for modeling based on scope

projects.title: Office Complex
projects.subtitle: Media & Marketing Studio with Private Residence
projects.description: Developed comprehensive facade design and interiors for a private office complex housing a media and marketing studio, with the top floor serving as the client's private residence. The project addressed significant spatial constraints through innovative design strategies that maximize natural light, ensure privacy, and create a breathable urban infill building. The design philosophy centered on creating a linear, vertically layered massing with rhythmic facade composition of vertical timber fins and horizontal slabs, blending modern geometry with warm material tones to modulate sunlight, filter heat, and visually elongate the facade.
projects.scope: Complete architectural design including facade design development, interior design for media/marketing studio spaces, private residence design for top floor, spatial planning and layout optimization, material selection and specification, lighting design strategy integrating natural and artificial light, biophilic design integration with facade planters, construction documentation, and design coordination with client and consultants.
projects.challenges: The site posed significant spatial limitations, being tightly enclosed by neighboring buildings on both sides, creating challenges in ensuring adequate daylight penetration, visual openness, and thermal comfort within the constrained urban setting. The design needed to balance privacy requirements for both commercial studio spaces and private residence while maintaining a sense of openness and connection to surroundings. Achieving thermal comfort and minimizing glare in a tightly constrained site required innovative shading and light diffusion strategies. The mixed-use program (commercial studio + private residence) demanded careful spatial organization and separation while maintaining design coherence.
projects.solutions: Developed a linear, vertically layered massing strategy that strategically introduces natural light through controlled openings while maintaining privacy. Implemented vertical timber fins on the facade as light diffusers, allowing soft daylight to filter through while reducing direct solar gain. Integrated planters along the facade to bring greenery into the vertical composition, adding a biophilic layer that softens the building's urban character. Designed angled slab projections and deep reveals to enhance shading, ensuring interior spaces receive indirect daylight even during peak sun hours. Created deliberate asymmetry and shift in facade depth to generate dynamic shadow play, giving the building a sculptural quality throughout the day. Inside, continued the design language with natural wood finishes, muted lighting, and earth-toned surfaces to create calm and sophistication. Used wooden slat ceiling and accent lighting to evoke rhythm and continuity, visually connecting interior planes with the exterior facade treatment. Balanced warm woods, concrete finishes, and dark metallic accents in the material palette for timelessness and low maintenance.

specifications.program: Media & Marketing Studio (lower floors) + Private Residence (top floor)
specifications.architecturalStyle: Modern urban infill with biophilic elements
specifications.facadeSystem: Vertical timber fins with horizontal slab projections
specifications.lightingStrategy: Natural light diffusion through vertical fins + artificial linear pendant lights and embedded strips
specifications.designOutcome: Urban infill prototype demonstrating how light, texture, and geometry can transform a limited site into a dynamic, daylit workspace

projects.title: Residential Interior
projects.subtitle: Interior Visualization & Design Consultation
projects.description: Delivered interior visualization and design consultation services for a residential project. Created detailed 3D interior models and photorealistic renderings that enabled clients to visualize design concepts and make informed decisions about interior spaces, materials, and finishes.
projects.scope: Interior design consultation, 3D modeling of residential interior spaces, material and finish visualization, realistic rendering with lighting simulation, design option presentations.
projects.challenges: Capturing the ambiance and spatial quality of interior spaces in 3D visualization. Accurately representing materials, textures, and lighting conditions. Creating renderings that helped clients understand design intent and make confident decisions.
projects.solutions: Utilized advanced lighting simulation techniques to create realistic interior ambiance. Developed detailed material libraries to accurately represent finishes and textures. Created multiple camera angles and perspectives to comprehensively showcase interior design concepts. Provided design consultation support to refine interior layouts and material selections.

specifications.deliverables: 3D Interior Models, Photorealistic Renderings, Material Visualizations
specifications.pricingModel: Flat fee for renders, variable fee for modeling based on scope
